definition[0]: to stop something from happening or developing
example[0]: rules and regulations that stifle innovation
example[1]: How can this party stifle debate on such a crucial issue?
definition[1]: to stop a feeling from being expressed
example[2]: He stifled an urge to hit her.
example[3]: I tried to stifle my laughter.
definition[2]: if you are stifled by something, it stops you breathing comfortably
example[4]: He was almost stifled by the fumes.
example[5]: I felt like I was stifling in the humid air.
explanation[0]: Stifle is usually passive in this meaning, when used as a transitive verb
